teaser: Smartphone apps are released all the time, but here's one that could be a first. It's a new app that asks users to help identify and thus apprehend sexual predators and other criminals. It's built by the Homeland Security Investigations unit within the U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement agency.
title: Marketplace Tech for Monday, September 16, 2013
description: Smartphone apps are released all the time, but here's one that could be a first. It's a new app that asks users to help identify and thus apprehend sexual predators and other criminals. It's built by the Homeland Security Investigations unit within the U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement agency.
